@before

Use @before decorator to execute function before page rendering. It is used to add variables to page context.

Example

from stado import run, before

@before('index.html')
def add_title():
    return {'title': 'Hello'}

run()

*File index.html:

{{ title }}

Rendered file output/index.html:

Hello

Details

@before can take any number of paths and also supports file matching.

@before('index.html', '*.html')
def add_title():
  return {'title': 'Hello'}

@before can pass page object to function using function first argument.

@before('index.html')
def add_title(page):
    page['title'] = page.source
